block.p: Joschka Fischer, Germany's foreign minister, is absolutely right to suggest that the German majority may be abetting anti-immigrant violence by not speaking out against it (news article, Aug. 1). Such violence shows that the energy behind German nationalism in the 1930's and the Holocaust has not been eliminated.

Furthermore, officials there continue to evidence their profound lack of domestic leadership and incapacity to play a legitimate role on the global stage despite German economic power in an increasingly interdependent world.
